meanings.definition: To engrave or carve into a surface.
meanings.sent1: She carefully insculps her initials on the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The artist insculps intricate patterns on the marble sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel insculps its tiny paw prints on the wet cement.
meanings.sent4: Time insculps memories deep into our hearts like etchings on stone.
meanings.sent5: The ancient civilization insculps their history on the walls of the temple.

meanings.definition: To impress or stamp a design onto a surface.
meanings.sent1: The jeweler insculps a delicate pattern on the silver bracelet.
meanings.sent2: The coin mint insculps the national emblem on the new currency.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy insculps muddy paw prints all over the clean floor.
meanings.sent4: Her words insculp a lasting impact on the listener's mind.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith insculps intricate details on the metal armor.
